comments.author: zanezane
comments.body: Quote from: Stef_C on May 16, 2023, 01:24:29 PMDoes anyone use platforms or services that offer crypto portfolio grading to evaluate the performance of a portfolio?I can suggest using CoinMarketCap, it provides a portfolio tracker that allows you to monitor their cryptocurrency investments and track their performance. It offers features like portfolio valuation, profit/loss tracking, and some basic performance analytics. I am also using Cointracking for its comprehensive cryptocurrency portfolio management platform that offers advanced portfolio tracking and analysis tools.https://coinmarketcap.comhttps://cointracking.info

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on May 16, 2023, 10:12:31 PMAnd so more here1. https://coinstats.appI used this app before and several third-party applications, and my experience with them was good, but I discovered that you can do a lot with Excel, where you can draw some diagrams, learn more, and thus improve the features instead of being limited to the features provided to you by third-party services, so I advise you Excel.start learning from this code https://github.com/KarmCraft/crypto-balance-excel-sheetAfter a few days you will be able to build something like this.

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Quote from: Stef_C on May 16, 2023, 01:24:29 PMDoes anyone use platforms or services that offer crypto portfolio grading to evaluate the performance of a portfolio?I'm using Coingecko and Coinmarketcap and since I have one portfolio that comprises new tokens there are coins that are not on Coinmarketcap and there are coins that are not on Coingecko, these are the best tool with varied portfolios because you can create as many portfolios as you like and if there's an update of the price and additional information about the coin it will be automatically added not only that both have a Playstore version so go for it you will like the experience.

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: Quote from: Stef_C on May 16, 2023, 01:24:29 PMDoes anyone use platforms or services that offer crypto portfolio grading to evaluate the performance of a portfolio?was used CoinTracker and still get a lot of spam from them for logging back in and enjoying the features.Although CoinTracker is beautiful and has many features, I do not recommend it.CoinGecko is the ideal solution for beginners, it provides you with a good feature to track currencies and the notifications work smoothly and you can use it from your phone or laptop alike, you only need to activate the notifications on the email.

comments.author: robelneo
comments.body: Quote from: Husires on May 18, 2023, 01:59:18 AMQuote from: Stef_C on May 16, 2023, 01:24:29 PMDoes anyone use platforms or services that offer crypto portfolio grading to evaluate the performance of a portfolio?was used CoinTracker and still get a lot of spam from them for logging back in and enjoying the features.Although CoinTracker is beautiful and has many features, I do not recommend it.CoinGecko is the ideal solution for beginners, it provides you with a good feature to track currencies and the notifications work smoothly and you can use it from your phone or laptop alike, you only need to activate the notifications on the email.I couldn't agree more it's on time when updating your portfolio value, you can create as many portfolios as you like, like one portfolio for the memes, or PVE, or top 10 coins in the market and you can easily track all of it.One of Coingecko's attractive features is their Candies rewards where you just need to log in daily and hit the collect button https://www.coingecko.com/account/candyYou can then exchange your collected candies on their rewards page https://www.coingecko.com/account/rewardsI've been using this for two years and never looked for other tools since this is already a complete one but it's your choice to use other tools for comparison.
